intro: Neesia ambigua, commonly known as the broad-leaved neesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its robust, herbaceous stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Neesia ambigua is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
